member.name: T:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.SOEElevationData
member.summary: This sample demonstrates how to use a custom Server Object Extension (SOE) hosted by ArcGIS for Server. The SOE operation used in this example returns a set of interpolated elevation values for a user defined grid. The grid extent and number of rows and columns are provided as inputs to the SOE.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.DriveTimes
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the Geoprocessor to call a DriveTimes geoprocessing service. To use the sample, click a point in the map. Drive time polygons of 1, 2, and 3 minutes will be calculated and displayed on the map.
member.title: Drive Times

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.DriveTimes.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs Drive Times sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.ExtractData
member.summary: Shows how to work with an asynchronous Extract Data geoprocessing service. The Extract Data Task lets users specify an area of interest then download a zip file that contains data for that area from one or more layers.
member.title: Extract Data

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.ExtractData.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Extract Data sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.MessageInABottle
member.summary: This sample demonstrates use of the Geoprocessor to call a MessageInABottle geoprocessing service. To use the sample, specify the number of days and click a point in the ocean. The path of a bottle dropped at the click point over the specified number of days will be drawn on the map.
member.title: Message in a Bottle

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.PopulationForArea
member.summary: This sample uses a geoprocessing task to estimate the number of people within a polygon you draw on the map. Click 'Summarize Population', then freehand a line on the map surrounding an area to analyze. When you release the mouse button, the polygon will auto-complete and you'll see how many people are estimated to live within the polygon boundaries.
member.title: Population for an Area

member.name: M:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.PopulationForArea.#ctor
member.summary: Construct Population for Area sample control

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.SmoothGraphicAnimation
member.summary: Animates a graphic smoothly between two user defined locations by calling the MapPoint.MoveTo method at regular intervals as defined by a DispatcherTimer. The distance the point is moved each time is calculated by a quintic easing function.
member.title: Smooth Graphic Animation

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.SetInitialCenterAndScale
member.summary: Shows how to set the initial center and scale of the map (Map.InitialViewpoint).
member.title: Set Initial Center and Scale

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.SetInitialMapExtent
member.summary: Shows how to set the initial extent of the map (Map.InitialViewpoint).
member.title: Set Initial Map Extent

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.SetSpatialReference
member.summary: Demonstrates setting the extent and spatial reference of a map via the Map.InitialExtent property.
member.title: Set Spatial Reference

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.ShowMapExtent
member.summary: Shows how to handle the ExtentChanged event on the MapView and display extent properties at runtime. Since the Map is in wrap-around mode, absolute values represent the map extent on an infinite continuous grid where values on the X axis increase or decrease as you pan. Normalized values represent the map extent in the real-world and take the dateline (or current central meridian) into account.
member.title: Show Map Extent

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.ShowMapScale
member.summary: Shows the map scale changing when you zoom in and out using the MapView.Scale property.
member.title: Show Map Scale

member.name: T:ArcGISRuntime.Samples.Store.Samples.ShowMouseCoordinates
member.summary: Shows mouse and device coordinates when the user taps the device.

member.summary: Shows how to swipe one map over another.

member.summary: This sample demonstrates adding and removing S-57 cells from an HydrographicS57Layer in the Map and accessing the Dataset Identification (DSID) metadata of those S-57 cells.
